disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents in my actions?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: by disregarding their advice on how to manage finances

disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: When frustrated with individual Catholics, did you reject the unity of the Church?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: on designated obligatory days , such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip fasting on designated obligatory days, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you deliberately skip days of fasting, particularly those that are obligatory such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you speak ill of the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: through my actions and attitudes towards them
disobedience.question: Have I, through my actions and attitudes towards them, dishonored my mother and father?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

disobedience.question: Have I disrespected my mother and father through my actions and attitudes?
disobedience.description: Respecting parental authority helps maintain proper order in families and society, and that parents deserve honor for their role in giving life, nurturing, and forming their children in faith and virtue.

extracted_data_phrases: from receiving Sacraments or attending Mass

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: by failing to address their spiritual concerns
condoning.question: Did I permit my child to continue in error by failing to address their spiritual concerns, even though it would have required me to have a difficult conversation?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than staying true to I believe what is right
to I believe what is right

condoning.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were left unburied?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

extracted_data_phrases: through their activities , relationships , or interests

extracted_data_phrases: to influences that could lead them away from our family 's Catholic values

condoning.description: Parents have to protect their children's well-being, guarding them from harmful elements that could damage their faith or lead them into sin.

condoning.question: Did I silently condone another Catholic's decision to marry outside the Church through my words?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

condoning.question: Did I give my approval to another Catholic who intends to marry outside the Church?
condoning.description: Marriage is a sacrament within the Catholic faith and thus giving approval and not admonishing the action gives scandal by condoning.

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone to be treated unfairly by my silence or inaction?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to suffer injustice?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Have I not neglected to provide assistance to those who needed it in their time of need?

lukewarmness.question: Am I uninterested in my faith?
lukewarmness.description: Lukewarmness in spiritual growth is sinful because one essentially chooses comfort and mediocrity over the transformative love God offers, which Jesus specifically warned against in Revelation 3:16.

sensuality.description: Prioritizing worldly pleasures and experiences over spiritual development is considered sinful as it violates the First Commandment by placing temporal desires above one's eternal relationship with God.

scandal.question: Did I try to encourage someone else to engage in sinful behavior through my actions?
scandal.description: Leading others to sin (also called "scandal") is sinful because it actively harms another person's soul by encouraging them away from God, making you spiritually responsible both for your own sin and for potentially damaging another's relationship with God.

impenitence.question: Have I stubbornly refused to change my mind about a particular sin, refusing to admit my wrongdoing?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

impenitence.question: Have I obstinately refused to acknowledge my wrongdoing, even when confronted by my own conscience?
impenitence.description: Impenitence is sinful because refusing to repent is a prideful rejection of God's mercy.

blasphemy.question: Did you swear to God in anger, frustration, or when speaking negatively about Him, even if just jokingly?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did I mock the Church, showing disrespect for its divine authority?
blasphemy.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of grave sin

blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: as an exclamation of disrespect or annoyance in conversation

blasphemy.description: This is sinful as using God's holy name carelessly or disrespectfully shows contempt for His divine nature and fails to give proper honor to the sacred name of God, which should only be used in prayer, worship, or respectful discussion.

greed.question: Have I made wealth and material possessions the driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

autonomy.question: Have you taken for granted the good things in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I have any thoughts that questioned God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Did you trust solely in your own abilities and failed to recognize your complete dependence on God's grace?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

fornication.question: Did I have any non-procreative, extramarital sex?
fornication.description: While the sexual natures are a gift, it's a sin to stray away from their ordering toward the unitive and procreative nature within marriage.

presumption.question: Did you procrastinate going to confession while in a state of sin, recklessly endangering your soul's salvation and demonstrating prideful presumption that you'd have time later to repent?
presumption.description: Deliberately delaying confession while in mortal sin is a serious offense because it recklessly endangers your soul's salvation, shows contempt for God's mercy through the sacrament of reconciliation, and demonstrates prideful presumption that you'll have time later to repent.
